labels.analysis: The MCP Server is primarily focused on collecting and analyzing threat information, allowing users to gather data on threats within specified date ranges. The available tools, such as "collect_threat_info," indicate that the server is designed for security-related data collection and analysis. The mention of integration with Neo4j suggests advanced capabilities for organizing and visualizing threat data using knowledge graphs.
labels.reasoning: The primary label is "Security & Authentication" because the server's core functionality revolves around threat data collection and analysis, which are key aspects of cybersecurity. The secondary label "Database Operations" is included due to the Neo4j integration for knowledge graph capabilities. The custom label "Threat Intelligence" is chosen to better describe the unique focus of the server on collecting and analyzing threat information, which is not fully covered by the predefined categories.

tools.name: collect_threat_info
tools.description: Collect threat info from start_date to end_date

server_info_crawled.name: Threat News
server_info_crawled.author: @xue20010808/threatnews
server_info_crawled.overview: Collect and analyze threat information efficiently. Utilize our tools to gather data on threats over specified date ranges and enhance your security insights. Integrate with Neo4j for advanced knowledge graph capabilities.

tools.name: collect_threat_info
tools.description: Collect threat info from start_date to end_date

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@xue20010808/threatnews/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
